Label: data heterogeneity
Concise definition: Diversity in the data caused by differences between individuals, samples or single entities (eg. single-cells) analysed.

Label: data integration
Concise definition: Process to join together data from different sources. Horizontal integration involves integrating same type of data from different experiments. Vertical integration involves integrating different types of data from the same samples.

Label: deep learning
Concise definition: Deep learning is part of a broader family of machine learning methods incorporating feature learning or representation learning (techniques that allow a system to automatically discover the representations needed for feature detection or classification from raw data). Deep learning is typically based on artificial neural networks. (from EDAM-BioImaging

Label: logic modelling
Attributes: hasSynonym algebraic logic model, logic model
Concise definition: Model where the discrete values of variables (also called levels) is determined by logical combinations of the values of other variables. (from MAMO)

Label: multiomics
Concise definition: Field of research concerning the use of multiple omics data applied to the same samples (e.g. genomics, ATA-seq, ChIP-seq, transcriptomics, proteomics, metabolomics)

Label: open science
Concise definition: Effort from the scientific community to make scientific data, results and software accessible to the public

Label: single cell omics
Concise definition: Field of research investigating single or multiple omics layers at the single cell resolution
